column4: So I set up Breezy, and things work, for the most part. But I still get the double-clock-speed/50% CPU at idle problem.
Any idea how to fix them?
why not try 686 kernel if you are on intel
I then flipped on over to the K7 kernel, because it seemed more in line with my system.
haven't you tried the kernel for 64's??? its a different ISO
I tried the AMD64 distro, but realized that nothing is actually compiled for 64-bit yet, such as Flash and things. And since I'm not running anything computationally intensive, I switched to 32-bit.
SOMEONE clearly knows how to do it, since it changeed between Hoary and Breezy....
Yeah, though I'd rather use Gnomebaker.
sudo passwd might allow you to reset it?
